item.title: Introduction
item.description: Get started There are two main ways to get started with Doks: Quick Start ðŸ‘‰ The Quick Start is intended for intermediate to advanced users. One page summary of how to utilize the API Network. Quick Start â†’ Go further Recipes, Reference Guides, Extensions, and Showcase. Postman API Workspace Information on the public Postman API Workspace Recipes â†’ Reference Guides Full list of supported endpoints. Reference Guides â†’ Contributing Find out how to contribute to API Network.

item.title: Quick Start
item.description: Requirements Doks is a npm project. Installing npm is pretty simple: download and install Node.js (it includes npm) for your platform. The Long Term Support (LTS) release is recommended for most users, the Current release contains the latest features. Start a new Doks project Create a new site, change directories, install npm packages, and start development server. Create a new site git clone https://github.com/h-enk/doks.git my-doks-site Change directories cd my-doks-site Install npm packages npm install Start development server npm run start Doks will start the Hugo development webserver accessible by default at http://localhost:1313.

item.title: Quick Start
item.description: Requirements Doks is a npm project. Installing npm is pretty simple: download and install Node.js (it includes npm) for your platform. The Long Term Support (LTS) release is recommended for most users, the Current release contains the latest features. Start a new Doks project Create a new site, change directories, install npm packages, and start development server. Create a new site git clone https://github.com/h-enk/doks.git my-doks-site Change directories cd my-doks-site Install npm packages npm install Start development server npm run start Doks will start the Hugo development webserver accessible by default at http://localhost:1313.

item.title: Commands
item.description: ðŸ’¡ You can change the commands in the scripts section of `./package.json`. start Start local development server: npm run start lint Check scripts, styles, and markdown for errors: npm run lint scripts Check scripts for errors: npm run lint:scripts [-- --fix] styles Check styles for errors: npm run lint:styles [-- --fix] markdown Check markdown for errors: npm run lint:markdown [-- --fix] clean Delete temporary directories:
